pr_title: Feat: Implement a Debian package comparator

timeline.message: remove references to rpm.vercmp in queries
remove references to rpm.vercmp in queries

timeline.bodyText: This is not anymore the test for PackageUtils. Should we move these tests to PackageEvrTest?
timeline.author: mcalmer

replies.bodyText: would make sense i did not do that the first time since i wanted to keep diff minimal but now we should do it.
replies.author: lucidd

timeline.bodyText: Why do we still store epoch, version and release as single values? Could we just change the getters to return packageEvr.getXXX() ?
timeline.author: mcalmer

replies.bodyText: i reworked this again and removed the packageEvr again since i found a place that read PackageStateJson from json which would not have worked.
replies.author: lucidd

timeline.bodyText:
Is it sufficient to use packageEvr directly? It might not contain the DB ID when it was just initialized with new.
Do we need the ID?
timeline.author: mcalmer

replies.bodyText: This is now fixed in the reworked version going back to using the lookup function and taking the evr type as parameter to this function instead.
replies.author: lucidd

timeline.bodyText: Nit (here and below): unsupported/unknown would be more fitting, IMHO. When we implement a new type, but forget to change this method, we will "reach the unreachable" in the log 😉
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason for modifying existing tests instead of just writing new? Don't we support comparing evr in format 0-0-0 anymore?
timeline.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText:
This format was only used for the tests here. It had a special parser only used here.
I think it is much better if we use the official format and the official parser.
replies.author: mcalmer

timeline.bodyText: Please either fix this right away or create a github issue.

timeline.bodyText: Noob question: is there any particular reason to prefer an ad-hoc method name to toString here?

+package com.redhat.rhn.domain.rhnpackage;
+
+public enum PackageType {
+    RPM("rpm"),
+    DEB("deb");
+
+    private final String dbString;
+
+    PackageType(String dbStringIn) {
+        dbString = dbStringIn;
+    }
+
+    public String getDbString() {

replies.bodyText: Its a left over from when i made the db representation only 1 character to safe space. I dropped the idea later in favor of maybe going the posrgres enum route at a later point. In short the difference between normal toString and the dbString is that the former should be human readable for showing logs/debugging while the latter can be a more obscure encoding for efficiency reasons. In the current implementation they are very similar so its not obvious.
replies.author: lucidd

timeline.bodyText:
Could we re-use data in this method to also check the stored procedure implementation of the algorithm?
One way to do it could be to create a List of those versions and then sorting it with the Comparator, and inspecting the sorted result.
timeline.author: moio

replies.bodyText:
This made me think and with your suggestions we moved the database tests into JUnit!
So we have now one single point to test the versions: Java (for Debian, and for RPM - as a bonus track - too!)
replies.author: mbologna
